response.overview: Little Minuet can't blow out the candles on her birthday cake and is afraid that her wishes won't come true. Bolero - the metal man, tells Minuet a fairy tale based on her fears: 'In an imaginary and magical kingdom lives Din-Din who loves to sing, drum and dance to the beat. The evil queen, who has three heads, is unable to dance at the party she is holding for herself and therefore decides to ban the use of the butt in the entire kingdom. The ban on the butcher stops life in the kingdom and threatens the life of Ollie - Dean-Din's little brother, whose heart is weak and needs a butcher. Din-Din goes to the palace to undo the evil decree with the stars, the magic drum, her fellow drummers and the townspeople. Will Din-Din be able to save her little brother and the entire kingdom? Join the minuet and through the answers to these questions you will learn about values ​​related to self-belief, love of music and rhythm, tolerance and acceptance of responsibility.
response.title: Dean Dean's Heartbeat
